articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Today’s Nintendo Direct revealed that Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 1, the enhanced bundle of classic Metal Gear games previously announced at the PlayStation Showcase, is also headed to Switch. We also have a better idea of what it entails including a release date. 
Arriving on October 24, this package is headlined by its HD remasters of Metal Gear Solid (including the VR/Special missions), Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty, and Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater. However, it also includes Metal Gear (both the NES and MSX versions), Snake’s Revenge, and Metal Gear 2: Solid Snake.


Bonus content includes strategy guides for each game, the Metal Gear Solid 1 and 2 digital graphic novels, screenplay and master books, and a digital soundtrack. 
Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 1 is headed to PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, Switch, and PC.
articles.title: Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 1 Heads To Switch, Launches In October

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is speeding closer to the end of its six waves of Booster Course Pass DLC, which is said to wrap up before the end of this year. During today's Nintendo Direct, we got our first details on Wave 5 of the Booster Course Pass DLC, which is set to hit within the next couple of months.
Booster Course Pass Wave 5 will feature an all-new course in the bathroom-themed Squeaky Clean Sprint, as well as three new characters. Petey Piranha, who made his debut in Mario Kart: Double Dash; Wiggler, who debuted in Mario Kart 7; and Kamek, who appears in Mario Kart Tour (and was a character in Mario Kart 64 before being replaced by Donkey Kong in the retail version) are all set to join the roster of playable racers in this wave of DLC. Seven more courses will join the pack as well, but we have no indication of which tracks those will be just yet. You can see the announcement trailer below.


Wave 5 of the Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Booster Course Pass arrives this summer. The Booster Course Pass is included as a part of the Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack subscription plan, or you can buy the DLC pack itself for $25.
articles.title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Wave 5 DLC Includes Brand New Course, Three Returning Characters

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Star Ocean: The Second Story is getting an HD-2D overhaul that slaps the letter R at the end of the title, a nod to the fact that it’s a remake.
The game first launched for PlayStation in 1998 (1999 in the U.S.) and stars protagonists Claude, a human federation officer, and Rena, a mystically powered girl, who players choose to control in separate campaigns. The game heavily emphasizes decision-making as your choices determine which of many playable allies you meet along the way join your party. 


This enhanced remake includes a modernized version of the game’s real-time combat; players can now stun enemies with chain attacks. Another cool addition is that party members not in combat can still lend a hand by executing assist-style follow-up attacks.
Star Ocean The Second Story R launches November 2 for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC.
articles.title: Star Ocean: The Second Story Remake Announced

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Nintendo has revealed that a "visually enhanced" version of Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon is coming to Switch next year. 
Dark Moon, otherwise known as Luigi's Mansion 2, was previously released as Nintendo 3DS-exclusive game, and its journey to Switch in 2024 marks the first time it will be playable elsewhere. To reveal the visually enhanced port, Nintendo released a short teaser trailer showcasing the game's fancy new visuals. 
Check out the Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon (for Switch) teaser trailer in Nintendo's tweet below: 
Get ready for some spooky shenanigans – a visually enhanced version of Luigi's Mansion 2 is coming to #NintendoSwitch next year! 👻 pic.twitter.com/TmsJcwb5dK
June 21, 2023
Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon hits Switch sometime in 2024.
articles.title: Nintendo 3DS-Exclusive Luigi's Mansion: Dark Moon Coming To Switch Next Year

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
When The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom arrived on May 12, its launch was accompanied by an Amiibo of Link. But Link was far from the only star of Nintendo's most popular game of 2023. During today's Nintendo Direct, the company announced the two other stars, Zelda and Ganondorf, are also set to receive Amiibo figures.
While the Tears of the Kingdom Link Amiibo is somewhat disappointing in its functionality (mostly the same as its Breath of the Wild counterpart), it provides special fabric for Link's paraglider. It appears as though fans should expect similar functionality from the upcoming Zelda and Ganondorf Amiibo figures, as the press release promises "valuable in-game items, as well as special fabric for the paraglider." 
The Tears of the Kingdom Zelda and Ganondorf Amiibo figures arrive later this holiday season. For more on what each Amiibo in the Legend of Zelda series does within The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, check out our Amiibo guide here. For a funny take on the poses Game Informer's Kyle Hilliard wishes the Tears of the Kingdom Link took instead, head here.
articles.title: Tears Of The Kingdom Zelda And Ganondorf Amiibo Figures Coming This Year

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Today’s Nintendo Direct ended with the reveal of a new 2D Mario game called Super Mario Bros. Wonder. Before you ask, this is not a new “New” Super Mario Bros. This brand-new adventure sports a revamped art style (and more expressive characters) and stars the familiar foursome of Mario, Luigi, Peach, and Toad in addition to Daisy and Yoshi.


The 2D worlds sport trippy features caused by a new power-up called the Wonder Flower. This transforms the world and gameplay in unexpected ways; pipes come to life, Mario can stretch his body to absurd lengths, and hordes of stampeding rhinos can appear, among other wacky effects. The biggest gasp came from a new power-up that transformed Mario into an elephant. Yes, you read that right. Mario's an elephant now, and it looks delightfully ridiculous. 
Super Mario Bros. Wonder looks like a trip, and it launches on October 20.
articles.title: Super Mario Bros. Wonder Is The Next 2D Mario Platformer

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Nintendo and Rocksteady have revealed Batman: Arkham Trilogy, a new trilogy collection that brings Batman: Arkham Asylum, Arkham City, and Arkham Knight to Switch later this year. 
More specifically, the Arkham Trilogy is due out this fall and promises to allow players to experience "the definitive versions of Rocksteady's Arkham Trilogy games." This trilogy also includes all post-launch content, including DLC expansions, suits, Batmobiles, and more. All three of these games have been available elsewhere for years but this trilogy marks the first time Switch players can play through all three games. 
Check out Batman: Arkham Trilogy in the reveal trailer below: 


Unfortunately, this trilogy does not include the (pretty great) Batman: Arkham Origins, which wasn't developed by Rocksteady; it was developed by Gotham Knights developer WB Games Montreal. However, the three games in this trilogy are still great, so it's still a good get for the Switch platform.
articles.title: Batman: Arkham Trilogy Hits Switch This Fall

articles.author: Matt Miller
articles.description:
In addition to a robust look at gameplay in Pikmin 4, today’s Nintendo Direct brought a small fun update on the older games in the series.
Whether you played the originals in 2001 and 2004 on GameCube, or you’ve always been curious to try out those early games in the franchise, Nintendo is providing a chance to explore the games once again. HD versions of both projects are headed into the Nintendo eShop today.
Both games were critically lauded in their day for the creative approach they took to puzzles and problem solving, as well as the charming presentation and setting.
articles.title: HD Versions Of Pikmin 1 and Pikmin 2 Arrive Today

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Nintendo has announced WarioWare: Move It, a new game in the long-running microgame series. 
The company revealed this during today's Nintendo Direct, highlighting the unique ways players can use two Joy-Con (and body movement) to complete microgames. One example shows a player using Joy-Con to balance Mario sliding in Super Mario 64. There's also plenty of first-person Wario action as well, with one microgame showing Wario trying to break out of what appears to be a jail cell. 


As you'd expect, WarioWare: Move It features a very unique, albeit strange, art style. Plus, it features two-player local co-op and a special Party Mode that allows up to four players to play various microgames together. 
WarioWare: Move It hits Switch on November 3.
articles.title: WarioWare: Move It Announced, Releasing This November

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Vampire Survivors, one of 2022’s best games, has dominated multiple platforms, but fans have clamored for it to come to Switch since its arrival. That wish will finally be granted on August 17.
The best vampire bullet hell with no vampires has scooped up numerous rewards for its satisfying, hard-to-put-down action and gameplay loop. It's a great fit for a handheld (as Steam Deck players will attest). Best of all, this version supports four-player couch co-op. Check out the new trailer below.
articles.title: Vampire Survivors Is Finally Coming To Switch With Four-Player Co-Op

articles.author: Blake Hester
articles.description:
Some of the team behind the well-liked Sonic Mania have a new game on the way. Penny's Big Breakaway was announced today during the most recent Nintendo Direct live stream and is expected to be released early next year. 
As you might expect, Penny's Big Breakaway is a colorful platformer with a focus on movement and traversal. Here's the game's full description:
"In this 3D platforming adventure, you’ll explore the bright and colorful world of Macaroon, and help Penny and Yo-Yo escape the clutches of the grouchy Emperor Eddie. Perform stylish, acrobatic tricks to avoid Eddie’s massive horde of pushy penguins in Story Mode. Power up Yo-Yo to protect Penny and put your speed running skills to the test in Time Attack Mode to unlock special items and complete secret stages."
You can check out a trailer below:


Penny's Big Breakaway is being made by Evening Star Studio, founded in 2018. This is its first game as a company.
articles.title: Penny's Big Breakaway Is The Next Game From The People That Made Sonic Mania

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Pikmin 4 is right around the corner, but that didn't stop Nintendo from flooding us with new information about the game during today's Nintendo Direct. From a new underground area, to night expeditions, to a new demo out next week, here's everything you need to know about Pikmin 4.


The main draw in the newest game in the Pikmin series is Oatchi, a dog-like companion that assists you and your Pikmin as you try to survive the cute and hostile alien world. In addition to helping out with lifting and pushing items, you and your Pikmin can ride him across land and water. You'll also be able to upgrade his abilities over time, increasing the amount of damage he does, the number of Pikmin he can carry, or the total weight of objects he can push.
You'll need those upgraded abilities to explore Pikmin 4's new underground areas, which appear to be more heavily centered around contraption-based puzzles. With more treasures and new enemies, it's a lot less open than the aboveground portions, but should provide an interesting challenge.
Finally, Pikmin 4 marks the first time in the series your explorer will be able to go on nighttime expeditions. Wild creatures are in a frenzy, making them much more dangerous, but you'll have the help of the new Glow Pikmin, a species only out at night. Instead of throwing them one by one, you can focus them into one glowing energy ball to release all at once, doing huge amounts of damage.
If you want to try it for yourself, a demo for Pikmin 4 will be available on the Nintendo eShop on June 28. The full game will be released one month from today, on July 21. For more on the game, check out the recent trailer that reveals you can customize your explorer, or download Pikmin 1 and 2 on your Switch right now.
articles.title: Pikmin 4 Has Night Expeditions, Glow Pikmin, And A Demo Out Next Week

articles.author: Matt Miller
articles.description:
Persona 5 Tactica was announced recently through the Xbox Games Showcase, but details on gameplay were limited. Today’s Nintendo Direct brought us a closer look at the game while highlighting the project's appearance on Switch consoles.
In the game, the group from Persona 5 is pulled into a new world, where they join forces with a new character named Erina, who is fighting as a revolutionary against the prevailing power in that place.
Gameplay allows for both up-close and ranged attacks over the course of its turn-based tactics encounters, but you can also use Personas to get your point across. Knocking enemies down opens up the “One More” action to double up damage. The game also encourages canny positioning choices, since surrounding your foes with three characters opens up the “Triple Threat” ability to deal big damage.
Drawing from the capability seen in Persona 5, you can also fuse Personas to create new ones.
Persona 5 Tactica is coming to PlayStation and Xbox consoles, as well as Switch, on November 17.
articles.title: Persona 5 Tactica Gets Gameplay Details In Switch Showing

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Detective Pikachu is back on the case in a new adventure arriving on October 6. 
It's called Detective Pikachu Returns, and the chatty, gruff-voiced Pikachu and his human partner Tim Goodman have a new batch of mysteries to solve in Ryme City. While we don't have a great sense of the game's plot or features, we'd wager there's plenty of investigative gameplay and puzzle-solving.


The first Detective Pikachu launched in 2016 for 3DS and was adapted into a live-action film in 2019.  We'll have to watch out to learn more about this follow-up in the coming weeks.
articles.title: Detective Pikachu Returns This October

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Princess Peach will star as the main character in a new game coming to Switch next year. 
Nintendo announced this during today's Nintendo Direct, stopping short of really any details beyond that. The company didn't reveal a name or any details about gameplay, but it did actually show gameplay and it looks exactly how you'd expect. We control Peach in a 3D world that looks reminiscent of something we'd see in a Super Mario RPG.
One interesting thing the Direct did reveal was that when Peach steps on a special pedestal, her outfit changes, going from her usual pink dress to a bright, light blue dress that seems to indicate she's powered up in some way. But the reveal ends there, with Nintendo promising more information at a later date. The last game to star Peach as the main character was 2005's Super Princess Peach for DS.
articles.title: Princess Peach Is Getting Her Own Game Next Year

articles.author: Blake Hester
articles.description:
Super Mario RPG is the next game to get the remake treatment. Announced today during Nintendo's most recent Direct live stream, the game will be released on November 17, 2023. 
The new Super Mario RPG trailer shows a variety of cutscenes and gameplay, including looks at turn-based combat and traversing the world. Take a look below:


The original Super Mario RPG was released for the Super Nintendo in 1996. Even as various other RPGs starring Mario have come out in the time since, many have clamored for a return to the Super Mario RPG series. While not an all-new game, a remake shows signs of life and will hopefully satisfy those fans.
articles.title: Nintendo Is Remaking Super Mario RPG

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Last February, Game Freak revealed that Pokémon Scarlet and Violet had DLC in the works, but all we got to show for it was a few pieces of concept art and static images of new Pokémon. Today changed that, as the Nintendo Direct showed off in-game footage for the very first time. Check it out for yourself below.


Titled “The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero,” this DLC comes in two waves. The Teal Mask is slated for this fall, while The Indigo Disk will come this winter. The first expansion will be available to play as soon as the player begins the treasure hunt, which happens a few hours into the game. Meanwhile, The Indigo Disk will require you to complete the entirety of the main story plus the previous expansion.
The first of the two expansions, The Teal Mask, will bring trainers to the land of Kitakami, an area completely distinct from the Paldea region they were born in. The adventure takes place during some kind of festival, and players will be tasked with unraveling mysteries tied to the local folklore. Part two, The Indigo Disk, takes place at Blueberry Academy, a school similar to Naranja and Uva Academy. As an exchange student, you’ll get to take classes, interact with students, and participate in the school’s battle-focused curriculum.
While the trailers didn't provide any major new announcements, we got another look at Pokémon we already knew about, like Okidogi, Munkidori, and Fezandipiti in the Teal Mask and Terapagos in The Indigo Disk. There are also new looks at the DLC's exclusive characters Carmine and Kieran.
No specific dates were announced today, but The Teal Mask will still be released this Fall, while the Indigo Disk will be released sometime this winter.
articles.title: Check Out The Gameplay Reveal Of Pokémon Scarlet And Violet's DLC

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Reviewed on:
      PlayStation 5
      
Platform:
      PlayStation 5
      
Publisher:
      Square Enix
      
Developer:
      Square Enix
      
Release:
                      	June 22, 2023
			
            
Rating:
      Mature
      
Final Fantasy XVI is bombastic, indulgent, and extreme, breaking far beyond the limits of what I thought an action-oriented Final Fantasy could pull off. It represents a pivotal shift for the series, ditching any semblance of turn-based move selection, active-time battles, or anything else in its history in favor of a fast-paced, extravagant, combo-heavy combat system that continued to grow more robust throughout my 60-plus hour journey. 
There’s a linear action game in FFXVI, and it’s the highlight of the experience. But standard RPG tropes, mechanics, …
articles.title: Final Fantasy XVI Review - Victory In The Land Of Gods And Monsters

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
If you subscribe to the digital edition of Game Informer, you can now learn all about Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon. Following the cover reveal, our digital issue is now live to subscribers on web browsers, iPad/iPhone, and Android devices.
Individual issues are also now available for purchase.
You can download the apps to view the issue by following this link.
articles.title: The Armored Core VI Fires Of Rubicon Digital Issue Is Now Live

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
Immortals of Aveum was revealed with a short teaser trailer at the 2022 Game Awards. The implication of the teaser was that it was a game in early development, which is why it was a surprise when the game was revealed to be releasing July 20, 2023. That release date has now slipped, but only be a few weeks. It is now launching a month and a couple of days later, on August 22.
You can find the full delay statement, signed by developer Ascendant Studios and the game's director, Bret Robbins, below.
As you know, this is our first game as a self-funded independent studio. We set out five years ago to ambitiously make an original Magic FPS in a new fantasy world. Along the way, we worked through a pandemic, built a new team, developed on Unreal Engine 5.1 and pushed the boundaries of what we thought was possible. Now, the finish line is in sight.
The recent feedback to the game proves to us what we already felt: that Immortals of Aveum is something special. In order to realize our full vision, we are going to take a few extra weeks, making our new launch date Tuesday, August 22nd. This will give us time to further polish the game, finish optimizing all platforms, and deliver a strong launch. We owe it to ourselves and to you to get this right.
For more on Immortals of Aveum's delay, you can find an official blog post here. For some of our positive hands-on impressions of the game, head here.
articles.title: Immortals Of Aveum Delayed One Month

articles.author: Blake Hester
articles.description:
By most measures, From Software's success is a surprise. Not because it makes bad games; time has proven it makes some of the greatest games of all time. But because it makes incredibly difficult, obtuse games, such as the Soulsborne titles, defined by their challenge and willingness to go against common game design philosophies. From Software reached a critical and commercial apex in 2022 when it released Elden Ring, its most popular game to date by a large margin. And now that it's become a household name in the gaming world, the studio is going back to its roots.
Early in June, we flew out to Tokyo, Japan, to visit From Software to be the first people in the world to see Armored Core VI Fires of Rubicon. While the AC series has been with From for its entire history as a game developer, …
articles.title: Cover Reveal – Armored Core VI Fires Of Rubicon

articles.author: Blake Hester
articles.description:
From announcement to release, Dead Island 2 was supposed to take less than a year. Instead, it took nine. 
Initially revealed on stage during Sony's 2014 E3 press conference, Dead Island 2 had an infamously rocky road to release. What briefly began in the early 2010s at Techland, the developer behind the first Dead Island and similar open-world zombie game Dying Light, then moved to Yager Development, then Sumo Digital, and then finally, Deep Silver's Dambuster Studio, was for many years a giant question mark in the game industry. Its publisher, Deep Silver, spent many of those years saying little to nothing about the game other than vague confirmations that it was still in development. Until it resurfaced in late 2022, a seeming sign that Dead Island 2 would see the light of day – which i…
articles.title: Inside Yager Development's Failed Attempt To Make Dead Island 2

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
The string of summer game showcases continues: Nintendo has announced a Nintendo Direct for tomorrow, June 21, at 7 a.m. PT/ 10 a.m. ET. The showcase will be focused "mainly on Nintendo Switch titles launching this year, including new details on Pikmin 4."
Tune in on June 21 at 7:00 a.m. PT for a #NintendoDirect livestream featuring roughly 40 minutes of information focused mainly on Nintendo Switch titles launching this year, including new details on Pikmin 4.
https://t.co/utzePnKjGc pic.twitter.com/ro5jotd6rD
June 20, 2023
While Nintendo's presence was typically a given back when E3 was still around, its relative silence over the last month left many to doubt whether or not there would be a summer showcase at all. The company's Twitter account has also been the source of a scattered handful of announcements lately, posting everything from new Joy-Con colors to a sequel to 1-2 Switch to a new trailer for Pikmin 4. Still, Nintendo has plenty to announce, whether it's something we expect (like Metroid Prime 4) or something entirely new.
We'll find out for ourselves at the livestream tomorrow.
What do you think Nintendo will announce tomorrow? Let us know in the comments!
articles.title: 40-Minute Nintendo Direct Announced For Tomorrow

articles.author: Charles Harte
articles.description:
Last December, Deadline reported that a Death Stranding movie was in the works. Kojima Productions, the studio that made the original game, was set to be one of two main producers, but there was no word on who would write, direct, or star in the film, or if any members of the original creative team would occupy any of those roles. Yesterday, Death Stranding's game director Hideo Kojima took to Twitter to clarify his involvement.
Just to be clear, I am deeply involved in producing, supervising, plotting, look, design and content of the film adaptation of DS, just not in charge of directing.
June 18, 2023
Here, Kojima confirms that he will not be directing the movie, but fans worried that Kojima Productions' involvement wouldn't involve input from the man at its helm can rest easy. In addition to his role as producer, Kojima will be "deeply involved" with many other elements of the film, including its plot and overall aesthetics. While the movie takes place in the existing Death Stranding world, it will "introduce new elements and characters within the Death Stranding universe," according to Deadline. Whether that consists of a retelling of an existing plot or an entirely new one is unclear, but it will certainly have that distinct Kojima touch.
In addition to the film-focused branch of Kojima Productions, the film will be produced by Hammerstone Studios. Founded in 2018, the studio's best-known films include Barbarian (2022) and Bill and Ted Face the Music (2020). The studio's founder, Alex Lebovici, had the following to say to Deadline about the upcoming project:
Given the fact that the production teams have yet to announce any director, writer or actor that's attached to the project (I'm hoping it involves Nicolas Cage), it's still a few years out. If you're dying for more Kojima before then, you can re-watch the Death Stranding 2 reveal trailer or fantasize about the game Kojima wants to make in space.
articles.title: Hideo Kojima Won't Direct The Death Stranding Movie, But He Is "Deeply Involved"

articles.author: Kyle Hilliard
articles.description:
In Eternights you are a coming of age teenager trying to find love... in the apocalypse. It's also a fast-paced action game. Eternights mashes together a few different genres and our reaction to the game's first hour is positive. Join Kyle Hilliard and Marcus Stewart as they take a look at the game's opening.


For more previews and discussions of some of the biggest games of 2023 and beyond, be sure to head over to our YouTube page for NGTs about Street Fighter 6, Bramble: The Mountain King, Humanity, Afterimage, Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster Collection, XDefiant, Sea of Stars, and Star Wars Jedi: Survivor.
articles.title: Eternights | New Gameplay Today

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Reviewed on:
      PlayStation 5
      
Platform:
      PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, PC
      
Publisher:
      Focus Entertainment
      
Developer:
      UN JE NE SAIS QUOI, Umanimation
      
Release:
                      	June 13, 2023
			
            
Rating:
      Everyone
      
Despite the protests of her father, a determined Mimi travels to the scenic French countryside of Dordogne to find a missing piece of herself. Awaiting her is the quaint home belonging to her recently departed grandmother, soon to be sold, as well as a summer’s worth of precious childhood memories Mimi inexplicably has no recollection of. How could she forget something so valuable, as well as the circumstances behind the rocky relationship between her father and grandpare…
articles.title: Dordogne Review – An Imaginative Escape

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
This week on All Things Nintendo, Brian invites Wesley LeBlanc on to recap their time at Summer Game Fest 2023. After running down some lingering news items, they chat about three games they played while at Summer Game Fest. For the main segment, Brian traveled to Blizzard's headquarters to be the first person to get his hands on a Story Mission from the upcoming Season 6 of Overwatch 2. After that, Brian and Wes chat about what they want to see in a potential summertime Nintendo Direct and end with an eShop Gem of the Week.
If you'd like to follow Brian on social media, you can do so on his Instagram: @BrianPShea. You can follow Wesley on Twitter: @LeBlancWes.
The All Things Nintendo podcast is a weekly show where we can celebrate, discuss, and break down all the latest games, news, and announcements from the industry's most recognizable name. Each week, Brian is joined by different guests to talk about what's happening in the world of Nintendo. Along the way, they'll share personal stories, uncover hidden gems in the eShop, and even look back on the classics we all grew up with. A new episode hits every Friday!
Be sure to subscribe to All Things Nintendo on your favorite podcast platform. The show is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts, and YouTube.
00:00:00 – Introduction



If you'd like to get in touch with the All Things Nintendo podcast, you can email AllThingsNintendo@GameInformer.com, messaging Brian on Instagram (@BrianPShea), or by joining the official Game Informer Discord server. You can do that by linking your Discord account to your Twitch account and subscribing to the Game Informer Twitch channel. From there, find the All Things Nintendo channel under "Community Spaces."
For Game Informer's other podcast, be sure to check out The Game Informer Show with host Alex Van Aken, which covers the weekly happenings of the video game industry!
articles.title: Overwatch 2 PvE, Disney Illusion Island Previews | All Things Nintendo

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Super Replay returns, and we're checking out Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts! Join us today on Twitch at 2:00 p.m. Central as we kick of the adventure, which will continue each week until we roll credits. We'll also have every episode available the next day on our Game Informer Shows YouTube Channel (or you can watch the videos in the above playlist). 
Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts was released for the Xbox 360 on November 11, 2008. The third (and, so far, final) entry in Rare's beloved platforming series centers on vehicle creation, where players collect and slap together hundreds of parts to assemble their own wacky contraptions to explore. The bevy of possible combinations and emphasis on player choice and creativity was largely unprecedented at the time, paving the way for future games such as the upcoming The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. However, this direction would divide fans due to how much it strays from the traditional Banjo formula. So where will I land on it? Let's find out.
Join me, Marcus Stewart, alongside Kyle Hilliard as we explore one of the Xbox 360's biggest hidden gems to see whether it holds up or falls apart like a poorly constructed doohickey. 
Watch on Twitch!
If you enjoy our livestreams but haven’t subscribed to our Twitch channel, know that doing so not only gives you notifications and access to special emotes. You’ll also be granted entry to the official Game Informer Discord channel, where our welcoming community members, moderators, and staff gather to talk games, entertainment, food, and organize hangouts! Be sure to also follow our second YouTube channel, Game Informer Shows, for to watch other Replay episodes as well as Twitch archives such as Replay, GI Live, and more.
articles.title: Super Replay | Banjo-Kazooie: Nuts & Bolts Part 7

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
After heading UK music industry trade organization BPI for years, Geoff Taylor will now take on the role of Vice President of AI at Sony Music. The switch from the anti-piracy frontlines to this newly created AI position is noteworthy and Taylor's former reflections on how the industry dealt with Napster could prove relevant to AI today.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Former Anti-Piracy Boss Becomes Sony Music’s AI Chief

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Pirate ebook repository Z-Library has released a dedicated desktop application that should make it easier to access the site going forward. The service is at the center of a criminal crackdown and has lost hundreds of domain names, which in part triggered the development of this new software.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Z-Library Releases Tor-Enabled Desktop Launcher to Improve ‘Accessibility’

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
More than 16 months into a war the Kremlin anticipated would be over in roughly three days, authorities in Russia continue to come up with 'innovative' ideas to limit the severity of the damage inflicted on its own entertainment sector. The latest plan is to start unblocking thousands of pirate sites but only if they comply with a set of stringent conditions they already ignore.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Russia Could Unblock Pirate Sites If They Agree to Censor Their Catalogs

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Every week we take a close look at the most pirated movies on torrent sites. What are pirates downloading? 'Extraction 2' tops the chart, followed by 'Fast X'. ‘John Wick: Chapter 4' completes the top three.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Top 10 Most Pirated Movies of The Week – 06/26/2023

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
The Interplanetary File System provides technical resilience against censorship but, for those who offer IPFS gateways, pressure to self-censor is mounting. Reports indicate that major publishing companies are carpet-bombing these volunteers with tens of thousands of DMCA notices, despite being fully aware that they are not responsible for the content in question and cannot take it down. One gateway operator has already called it quits.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Publishers Carpet-Bomb IPFS Gateway Operators With DMCA Notices

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Pirate IPTV services have transformed into a billion-dollar industry in recent years. It is a highly profitable business that, at the upper echelon, appears to be well organized. However, research from the Digital Citizens Alliance shows that handing over credit card details to unknown parties also has its drawbacks, including 'surprise' charges. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sharing Your Credit Card With a Shady Pirate IPTV Service Isn’t a Brilliant Idea

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
By pretending to be legitimate music rightsholders, two men managed to extract over $23 million in revenue from YouTube's content-ID system. Both were arrested, pleaded guilty, and now face multi-year prison terms. This week, the U.S. requested a 70-month sentence against the 'number two' of the operation, in part to deter future fraud.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: U.S. Seeks 70-Month Prison Sentence for YouTube Content ID Scammer

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Italian police say they have targeted 13 people in Italy and Germany suspected of selling access to pirate IPTV services. Italian police units collaborated with their counterparts in Germany, with international judicial cooperation channels coordinated by Eurojust. Police say they seized over 620,000 euros in cash and crypto, and shut down 60 Telegram channels.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate IPTV: Police Target 13 Suspects, Seize 620K Euros in Cash/Crypto

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
Since 2012, Kim Dotcom has been fighting extradition to the United States where he faces serious charges related to cloud storage site Megaupload. During that time, very little has been said about Megaupload graphic designer, Julius Bencko. A wanted man in the U.S., Bencko was arrested this month by armed police in the Czech Republic, who filmed the event and published it online.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Megaupload Fugitive Arrested By Armed Police 11 Years After The Raid

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
'AI Hub' is a rapidly growing Discord server where users share guides and AI models, including voice models of major musicians. The RIAA suggests that the server is dedicated to copyright infringement and wants it shut down. Through a DMCA subpoena, the anti-piracy group further asks Discord to disclose the identities of several users.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RIAA Targets ‘AI Hub’ Discord Users Over Copyright Infringement

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Through a California federal court, a group of filmmakers wants Reddit to disclose the identities of several users who made piracy-related comments. The filmmakers say the users could provide key evidence in an ongoing lawsuit against Internet provider Grande. In line with its response to a similar request earlier this year, Reddit objects once again, citing its users' right to anonymous speech.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Filmmakers Take Reddit to Court Again to Unmask ‘Piracy’ Commenters

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
With tens of millions of regular monthly visitors, South Korean piracy site Noonoo TV made powerful enemies. The stand-off reached the boiling point in March when broadcasters formed a new anti-piracy coalition and warned of punishing legal action. Noonoo TV responded by throwing in the towel but after clone site 'Noonoo TV Season 2' appeared online, the government says it will develop an AI anti-piracy system that will stop any 'Season 3' variants in their tracks.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Korea Will Deploy ‘Anti-Piracy AI’ After Major Piracy Site Reincarnation

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The US Copyright Claims Board allows rightsholders to file damages claims outside of the federal court system. Since its official launch last year, hundreds of cases have been presented to the board. Typical copyright trolls were noticeably absent and thus far there's been just one award for damages, as the vast majority of all claims are dismissed.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Copyright Claims Board Celebrates First Anniversary Without a Troll Party

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
There are fears that Russia's black-market supply of unlicensed Hollywood movies could soon dry up. Cinema insiders say Kazakhstan-based company 'WesternRus" had been supplying keys to cinema chains to unlock localized mainstream movies. Announcing an indefinite suspension of its activities, WesternRus cited "high levels of piracy" as the main reason for throwing in the towel.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Pirate Movie Supplier Quits After Russian Pirates Cammed its Pirate Releases

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
A recent publication by the Audiovisual Anti-Piracy Alliance signals app piracy as a growing problem that has room for improvement. Rightsholders could collaborate more intensely with app stores, for example. Meanwhile, app platforms could implement know-your-customer verification, while deploying automated tools to scan for and filter apps that use known pirate keywords.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Anti-Piracy Group Signals Opportunities to Tackle Online Piracy Apps

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
At the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar, defending champions France couldn't prevent Argentina from lifting the trophy. Back on home soil, French telecoms regulator Arcom blocked 83 domains during the tournament but couldn't prevent some fans from streaming games illegally. The conundrum for Arcom is that if it cracked down on the most prolific football pirates, it would also be cracking down on the fans most likely to use paid, legal services.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Most Prolific World Cup Pirates Also Most Likely to Use a Paid Service

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
Copyright holders have sent billions of takedown requests to Google. Their goal is to make it harder for people to find pirated content through the search engine. However, when legal options such as Reelgood are targeted, takedown requests can end up being counterproductive.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Netflix and Amazon DMCA Notices Target Legal Streaming Options

articles.author: Andy Maxwell
articles.description:
A researcher who alerted Sky to a security hole that allowed anyone to watch NOW TV subscription channels for free claims the problem went unfixed for months. Emails seen by TorrentFreak show that Sky was made aware of the piracy loophole in January 2023 but encryption keys were still working until at least early June. What Sky could've actually done is unclear.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Sky ‘Free NOW TV’ Security Hole Exposed For Months, Researcher Claims

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The Motion Picture Association sees the open-source Android app Cloudstream as a gateway to pirated streams. This week, the anti-piracy group successfully removed two 'infringing' code repositories from GitHub but a stripped-down version of the application remains unscathed. 
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: GitHub Takes Down Cloudstream APK Code Repo Following MPA Complaint

articles.author: nospam@scummvm.org (OneEightHundred)
articles.description:
Muppet Treasure Island, the second mTropolis game playable in ScummVM, is ready for public testing!
Created in 1996 by Activision and based on the movie of the same name, this game has you play the role of Jim Hawkins as you join the Muppets on a voyage to find a pirate’s buried treasure, and features additional live-action performances by Billy Connolly and Tim Curry.
ScummVM currently supports the Windows CD-ROM release in several languages (English, Spanish, Italian) and the English Macintosh CD-ROM.  If you’re aware of any other versions, please contact us.
To play any of these supported releases, you will need a daily development build. If you encounter any issues, please submit them to the issue tracker!
>
articles.title: Hey, Hawkins, nice to see you again!

articles.author: nospam@scummvm.org (DreamMaster)
articles.description:
A stalwart party exploring the unknown, seeking the fabled Inner Sanctum. But all is not what it seems in the world of Varn...
The ScummVM Team is pleased to announce full support for the PC version of the first game of the Might and Magic series: Might and Magic Book One: The Secret of the Inner Sanctum. Two modes are supported:
The original look and feel of the game (sound, which in the original consisted of merely the occasional beep, is not supported)
A ScummVM-exclusive enhanced mode, which uses the interface of the later Xeen games, including niceties such as better character screens, automapping, and sound effects. It also integrates the impressive "Might and Magic 1 Graphics Overhaul Mod", which provides better in-game map and monster graphics. The xeen.cc file is required from Might and Magic: IV or Might and Magic: World of Xeen.
Both modes allow saving your game anywhere outside of combat via the ScummVM Global Main Menu (unlike the original game that only saved a single roster when checking into an inn). So make sure you save regularly, just in case you encounter problems.
Help us test both game modes by grabbing a daily build and adding mm.dat to the same folder as your game files. Read through our testing guidelines, and please take some screenshots along the way.
Now, go forth, and discover the true secrets of the game that started the long running epic fantasy series!
>
articles.title: Journey Now Into an Age of Chivalry in an Alternate Reality

articles.description: Only a day after 13.2, we present 13.3. And there is a bit of a story here. But in short: we made a mistake with 13.2.1, and need to release a 13.3 with no functional change to make sure multiplayer games work as expected.
articles.title: OpenTTD 13.3

articles.description: As I write this many of the development team and other members of the community are busy having fun at a meet-up in Brussels. Not me though, I’m stuck here doing a release. We’ve been busy refactoring quite a lot of the underlying code to make future changes easier, but along the way we’ve found and fixed a few more bugs and quality of life improvements that we figured were worth releasing sooner than whenever 14.0 comes along. Notably, OpenTTD will now automatically disable hardware acceleration if it detects that the last crash happened while initialising the graphics driver. While hardware acceleration works well for the vast majority of people, it causes crashes for people that then required command line arguments or manual config file editing to get it to work. This should be a better solution for those users. Additionally, there is a change to the default mouse mode on Linux to improve experience when dragging the map (and often to match expected behaviour in other games). As always, there are plenty of other bugfixes, which you can find in the changelog. While you’re at it, have you seen the post about the upcoming addition of a automated opt-in survey to OpenTTD 14? If you have opinions, we’d like to hear them! Details here. Download Changelog Bug tracker
articles.title: OpenTTD 13.2

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
You can remotely join regular hybrid Raspberry Pint events wherever you are in the world. Check our our community events page to see what else is happening.
The post Join London’s hybrid Raspberry Pi live event appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Join London’s hybrid Raspberry Pi live event

articles.author: David Plowman
articles.description:
Here's an in-depth guide to the Raspberry Pi Camera Module’s still image capture modes and settings. 
The post Raspberry Pi Camera Module: Still image capture appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi Camera Module: Still image capture

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
The PiFinder is a Raspberry Pi-based open source project for the amateur astronomy community, created by Richard Sutherland.
The post Superior stargazing with the PiFinder appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Superior stargazing with the PiFinder

articles.author: Andrew Gregory
articles.description:
The folks at HackSpace magazine have been having an awful lot of fun playing with/thoroughly testing the latest offering from Prusa Printers, the Mk 4. As part of that, they got the chance to pick the brains of Mr Průša himself.
The post Meet Josef Průša: Founder of Prusa3D appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Meet Josef Průša: Founder of Prusa3D

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
We love this little nostalgia hit by SQFMI SQFMI. It's a Raspberry Pi-powered Blackberry-like handheld and it's adorable.
The post Beepberry cures lack of Blackberry appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Beepberry cures lack of Blackberry

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Erin St Blaine created this magic storybook which uses Raspberry Pi, ChatGPT, and people's imaginations to put endless original tales in the hands of readers.
The post Magic storybook writes whatever tale you want appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Magic storybook writes whatever tale you want

articles.author: Rob Zwetsloot
articles.description:
In honour of #MagPiMonday, let there be light with these incredibly illuminating projects.
The post 10 amazing lighting projects appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: 10 amazing lighting projects

articles.author: Ashley Whittaker
articles.description:
Because Raspberry Pi is small, affordable, and hackable, we find ourselves popping up in the wildest corners of the planet, monitoring the natural world around us. We're everywhere from the rainforests of Borneo to the Antarctic home of Adelie penguins. We've even been attached to the backs of turtles. Yes, really.
The post Raspberry Pi in the natural world appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi in the natural world

articles.author: Rosie Hattersley
articles.description:
BearID is the kind of engaging project that everyone loves: using face-recognition technology, it helps work out how many individual bears live in an area and monitors their movement and health.
The post BearID: Face recognition for brown bears appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: BearID: Face recognition for brown bears

articles.author: Eben Upton
articles.description:
Raspberry Pi Pico W, our $6 wireless-enabled variant of our Pico platform, built around our RP2040 microcontroller, now has Bluetooth support.
The post New functionality: Bluetooth for Pico W appeared first on Raspberry Pi.
articles.title: New functionality: Bluetooth for Pico W
